citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
At approximately 10:15 am, the inspector arrived and knocked on the house door. Receiving no response, the inspector
knocked on the door to the kennel building. A man, who identified Karen Miller as his wife, answered the door and said
this was not a good day for inspection. He was informed that, since we are within the licensee’s optimal hours, not
allowing an inspection would be a refusal of inspection. He said to give him a couple of minutes and shut the kennel door
without offering to let the inspector enter. He returned a few minutes later and said that he had someone there that he
was paying to do painting and did not want to do the inspection today. He was informed that the licensee would receive a
citation for refusing inspection. The inspector then left the facility.
A licensee’s refusal to allow inspection of the animals, facility and records interferes with the ability of APHIS officials to
ensure the welfare of the animals and to enforce of the provisions of the Animal Welfare Act, the regulations, and the
standards. The licensee must provide access for inspection when requested by APHIS officials.
Correction Date December 1st, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
